Reviews.Title: One of the best in its category, but has its drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Christopher D. Blanchette
Reviews.Content: This notebook is very stylish and has solid manufacturing.  I think everyone knows that by now.  It is much more sturdy than the Acer 13.3" laptop that I tried, although the HP is about 1 lb heavier.  At any rate, everything has its drawbacks, here are mine:1) Touchpad simply doesnt work with the multi-touch gestures enabled.  When you open the notebook from hibernating, the mouse freezes and requires a hard shutdown to resolve.  Disabling the multi-touch gestures gets rid of this problem.  Also, the trackpad is jumpy and inaccurate at times.  For the average user, this really is not a big deal.  I consider myself an above average computer geek and I really have been able to manage just fine with it.  I did have to disable the multi-touch gestures(which gets rid of two finger scrolling, zoom pinch, etc) because there is a driver issue that makes it not work right.  (there is no resolution for this yet).2) Battery Life.  Other users of the same notebook with the intel processors have been getting 7+ hours of battery life with 50% screen brightness and normal wifi usage.  The best I can get on my machine is 4-5 hours.  To me, this is unacceptable given the standard set by other computers.  I spent 45 minutes on the phone with HP discussing the problem, but they wouldnt send me a new battery, so I'm unsure if it is just my machine.  It very well could be something wrong with mine, but it couldnt be figured out.  Just something people should be aware of as a possibility if you buy this machine.3) No dedicated home, end, page up, and page down keys.  It's really not a HUGE deal but I kinda wish they had just shrunk the keyboard size a little to include these keys.All things considered, my complaints really arent that bad.  Overall I am satisfied with my purchase.  It's definitely a sexy notebook that is snappy during everyday use.  Screen is great, as is the chiclet-style keyboard(best in class in my opinion).

Reviews.Title: Better than a stick in the eye
Reviews.Author: D. McIver
Reviews.Content: Quick review - purchased this laptop for a friend.  Wanted something fairly light but powerful -- this HP is a great blend of the 2 needs.  I looked at the AMD chip version in a retail store and got this one (faster and more RAM) for less... it is Amazon after all!I am (and more importantly, my friend) very pleased with the performance.  The screen height is short, so using this laptop to remote onto another machine (Remote Desktop or GotoMyPC) have presented him with some "getting used to" -- otherwise, it's peppy.Take special note on the specs -- this HDD is the faster model, which makes a big difference in performance.Overall - great buy!  If I was shopping for one for myself, I'd buy it if I wasn't a Mac fan :-)Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop For the Budget
Reviews.Author: WhatDaHeLL
Reviews.Content: Got mine last month from MS Store with 40% the MSRP bring it down to $488.70 after CA tax... Plus 3% from Bing Cashback. So it is around $465. This laptop works like a champ to me. Not really fast with the Intel Pentium SU4100 but for the 320G 7200RPM HD and 4GB DDR3 Ram, it is considered fast to me! Small, portable and fit my budget that's all that count. Haven't since any hang in moment or blue screen like other stated yet. It works good so far.

Reviews.Title: HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!
Reviews.Author: BirdGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer in mid December 2009 and I have had nothing but problems with it right out of the box.  The freezing issue after putting it to sleep is highly annoying.  Additionally, it turns out after I spent hours on the phone with tech support and ended up having to perform a system recovery, that there is a known issue with the sound on the computer.  Music sounds like it's being played on a record player with a very worn needle and the same popping and crackling noises come through on Skype and video chat.  I'm sending it back in exchange for a new one, but I have no doubt that the second computer will have the same problems.  And mind you, I purchased the computer direct from HP with all the upgrades.  Stay away!

Reviews.Title: Very Balanced Little Package
Reviews.Author: PsychDoc
Reviews.Content: This really hits the new sweet spot for portable laptops. I think by now pretty much everyone's over the netbook craze. Yeah, great idea but at the end of the day they're way too small and they have almost no computing power with those wimpy Atom processors. yet most of us who travel don't want to lug around a 15"-16" brick. Along comes the 13.3" form factor. Amd with it, HP almost hit a grand slam with this DM3. As many others have correctly said, the track pad is nothing short of awful and the mouse buttons are too stiff. That pretty much sums up the negatives of this otherwise wonderful machine. The display is gorgeous, it's fast as all get-up (I have the Su7300 processor and 7200 rpm hard drive), it has plenty of RAM (4 gigs), the speakers are more than acceptable for a small laptop, battery life is awesome and it's a classy looking unit clad in all metal.I'm one of those who remember when laptops cost upwards of $1500 for a bare bones machine that couldn't do half of what this one does. At it's price point, it's a steal. Highly recommended.But HP should be ashamed of it's horrid touchpad. C'mon guys, you can do better!!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Ultra Portable LapTop
Reviews.Author: K. Santos
Reviews.Content: This is the best Laptop I have ever owned not to mention its great looking exterior. I've never had a problem with its touchpad after disabling it via mouse settings. There is an instructional video as to how to do it on youtube. It runs perfectly on windows 7 ultimate. This is definitely the best laptop of its kind as far as looks, performance, and portability. The only downside I find with it is how hard the touchpad buttons are but I can easily live with it given its very strong points. The Pentium version is definitely better than the AMD one in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Nice Laptop, But could have been better
Reviews.Content: I payed 433.76 for this baby at Office Depot, my first Laptop I saved for with my babysitting money, and 5 months later I'm still pretty happy with it. I run the Sims 3 on it and it works great! I have all but 2 of the expansion packs, and that's a lot of games, and it's still really fast.There are some things I don't like though...-Overheats, I had to bay a lap desk that blocked off heat so I wouldn't burn my legs off! :D- Short battery life, It doesn't bug me all that much because I'm usually around an outlet, but when on wifi it lasts only for about 3 hours.That's it! Overall Great laptop and I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this awhile ago at a great price, and have to say I'm impressed with it.  Although it isn't going to break any speed records, Windows 7 functions well enough on it.  Definitely ample processing power for web browsing and document editing.  I've watched Netflix without any issues.[...]PROS:*Slim- this is noticeably thinner than my girlfriend's 14" HP.  As a matter of fact, it's more compact all around, with very little empty real estate.*Design- the all metal body looks SHARP.  There isn't a huge glowing HP logo, or any kind of design on it.  Just smooth brushed metal with a small HP logo in the corner. Makes the laptop look very expensive.*Keyboard and Touchpad- Although I've read in a lot of the reviews that other buyers don't like the keyboard or touchpad, I think they're great.  Yes, the touchpad collects fingerprints.  Wipe them off.  The multi-touch is amazing, too.  I've been on several other laptops since I bought this and always catch myself getting frustrated when pinching or stretching my fingers over the keypad doesn't do anything.*Durable-  I don't know if I got lucky, but within a few weeks of buying it I dropped the laptop (while open) off the back of my couch.  It fell over 3' to the ground and just left a small crack in the plastic trim around the body.  I've also knocked it off my bed and chairs numerous times and it's held up.CONS:*No Internal Optical Drive-  this is isn't really that big a deal to me, as most information gets passed wirelessly on my home network or through email.  But if you're looking at burning CD's you'll need to carry an external drive everywhere, which defeats the purpose of having such a small laptop.*Battery Life- terrible.  I don't know where companies get battery life numbers from, because mine only lasts for about 4 hours before dying out.  You'll need to keep the power cord with you at all times.*Plastic Trim- With such an expensive looking body, it really bothers me that the rim of the body is plastic (the part that wraps around where the USB ports and memory card slots are), and the silver paint is already wearing off.  How much more would it have cost for HP to make that metal as well?Overall a good value PC.

Reviews.Title: hp dm3t mouse pad and wireless
Reviews.Author: CA
Reviews.Content: Bad1. Mouse pad buttons are sensitive to finger movements. How someone can re-size or move the window across the screen? I also couldn't figure out how to do a right click,... really creepy. I had to attach an external mouse to use this thing.2. Network card driver doesn't see hidden networks, just plainly can't connect. This issue affects Ubuntu Linux, Windows 7 premium and this internal Linux hp puts in the bios (HPWeb or something), I didn't try other versions but I assume it is an issue with wireless network driver (I think it is  broadcomm) similar to this one [...].Good1. Very clear display2. Good sound3. Nice design

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Jacks
Reviews.Content: I love my laptop because it works fine, but as I use it a lot for school, the silver paint from the sides has worn out.So the durability is not so great, it even has dents on it because I take it everywhere and accidentally bump it in everyplace. And as for the mouse problem, it can be fixed, not such a big deal. Once I start using the laptop for a long time, it tends to get really hot (and run slow) so it shuts down... I fixed this by getting a laptop cooler, and now it works fine. I would buy this laptop again, just so it would looked prettier, since mine has worn out from the sides.

Reviews.Title: It's so good, but . . .
Reviews.Author: Antonio Carrero
Reviews.Content: In general spects, it's very light and fast laptop, but i thing the keyboard it's a little unconfotable y the touchpad buttons are very hard to press and the battery power is not longer than 6 hours.

Reviews.Title: Good notebook
Reviews.Author: G. K. Gibson
Reviews.Content: I'm quite pleased with this notebook.  It is thin and light.  The performance is great.  I had trouble with the touch pad and the video.  HP Support initially gave me bad information about the fixes for both problems, but the touch pad problem was eventually fixed by getting a BIOS update and the video problem was fixed by a video driver update.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Angel Martinez
Reviews.Content: Overall this product is a great deal for the price. Only con with this laptop is the mousepad. It locks up coming back from sleep if the gestures are turned on. Also its surface leaves less to be desired. It's metallic surface is not smooth enough and leaves it feeling "sticky".

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRICE, VALUE, ETC.... INTERNATIONAL BUYER
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Toledo
Reviews.Content: I've just recieved this computer after a long research for a good laptop. aND I can assure it's awesome, for the price... it's an incredible value, I've just seen one identical except that it had just 3GB Ram here on Guatemala on Sale at Q9,500 which is about $1,200, and I bought mine at less than half of that. Also its gorgeous, really gorgeous. It has its own flaws, but non that are really really bad. I haven't had any trouble with the pad at all, its fast, its slick its a great laptop overall, also is incredibly quiet and cool. Way better than anything of this price.If its lower than $550 dont think about it, just buy it.

Reviews.Title: Boa relação custo benefício
Reviews.Author: Fabio V. F. Roseira
Reviews.Content: É um note muito bom, com boa relação custo x benefício!Prós: Leve, bonito, rápido para um Dual, tela muito boa.Contras: não tem DVD (acredite!), o touch pad não é dos melhores.

Reviews.Title: totally super !!
Reviews.Author: Jose U. Manansala
Reviews.Content: I am totally satisfied with my new HP Pavillon DM3 Silver Laptop. Its fast and has significantly improved and added value to my work. I am very thankful for having the chance to purchase such a product. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: Could be a great computer, but sadly it is not.
Reviews.Author: G. Drobny
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer 2 weeks before Christmas. I had never owned an HP before and despite my friends telling me to avoid this computer the look won me over and I bought it. I should have listened to my friends because I have had nothing but issues with the track pad, this includes freezing and zooming in and out for no reason. I fixed this by turning off all the finger commands. Suddenly on Jan. 5th, the computer would not turn on. This computer could have been a great laptop if it was not for the terrible track pad and it breaking on me after only about 25 times being used. As soon as I get it back from repair I am selling it and never buying another HP computer again.Pros:Sleek sexy lookGreat specs for the priceCons:Terrible track padUseless software installedSound quality is poorI would suggest avoiding this laptop and buying an Asus or Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Screen problem and poor battery life
Reviews.Author: Kathleen A. Harris
Reviews.Content: I talked myself into a HP because I loved the keyboard and size of this unit however within a day I noticed the screen would turn itself dimmer and that the battery was not lasting anywhere near the 10 hours claimed.  I decided to return the laptop and eat the restock fee.  I don't trust a brand that ships with known problems. If it had these problems out of the box, what was going to happen in 3 months.

Reviews.Title: Looks cool, otherwise useless
Reviews.Author: buy less, live more
Reviews.Content: looks cool, that's about it. get's hot, uncomfortably warm on the wrist rests. and it's slow. and the speakers are weak. and there's a ton of bloatware. screen is very reflective. feels fragile. battery life more like 5 hours than the advertised 10. blah. the screen dims and brightens on it's own and the inaccurate trackpad pretty much solidify this as a useless piece. Returned after 3 days. I just got this  Acer Aspire AS5740-6025. so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Poor product, no support whatsoever.
Reviews.Author: Lisa L.
Reviews.Content: I couldn't get the program to work correctly.  When it crashed without ability to access anything I installed the recovery discs which I had to pay for and have sent.  About a week's worth of no computer.  The discs wouldn't install at all but then did after using safe mode.  Not everything installed.  But be very careful because if you receive an update it will cause the program to not work again.  Re-install.  HP would do nothing for me.  You write to them, they call, they offer to have you pay for them to look at it. Another week no computer.  They tell you its fixed.  Its not.  They do nothing.  Bought another laptop NOT HP.  Went to our local busiest store, the salesman tells me that 80% of what they have in for repairs is HP.  Great, hundreds of dollars for instant garbage.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Charles Thomas
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in not being informed that the computer did not include a DVD/CD internal player, and no information was given as to the appropriate external player.I should have been warned and the exact available external DVD/CD players recommended, especially for first time buyers!!!Thanks
